alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Noble; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:05PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Oklahoma, central Lincoln, south central Noble, eastern Logan and western Payne Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Mulhall to 3 miles southeast of Meridian to near Luther to 7 miles south of Warwick. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Guthrie, Chandler, Perkins, Langston, Luther, Davenport, Wellston, Carney, Tryon, Ripley, Agra, Coyle, Mulhall, Sparks, Warwick, Kendrick, Meridian, Fallis, and Lake Carl Blackwell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 156 and 178. Interstate 44 between mile markers 149 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
